creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: wooden tray with tree: wide brown trunk with moss; three puffs of green foliage; silver rim; rounded edges
medium: Ink and color on Paulownia wood and silver
text: In Japanese iconography, the pine tree is a symbol of winter and longevity. Here, used as a decorative element, it is reminiscent of the Rinpa style of painting, revived by Kamisaka Sekka after its peak in the 1700s. The pine’s trunk features the typical puddle-ink technique (tarashikomi) of that style.
title: Tray with old pine tree
